messageBody:
gscokart wrote:

> I have a class that use TCP (java.net.Socket), and I fear that the
> way the TCP errors are handled are not correct.

Let me see whether I understand: you're writing code that uses Socket
and you want to check how it reacts to errors from a Socket object.

Either extract an interface from Socket with the method you invoke that
might send back the error, OR try jMock, which lets you mock a method on
a concrete class. As long as you know how Socket reports the error, then
you can simulate that in a test for your error-handling code.
